subject: Re: [junit] Are tests run concurrently
msgSnippet: ... JUnit never runs tests concurrently. You can, however, build multithreaded test case classes. -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
Oisin Kim wrote:

> Hi all,
> I've been looking to check that Junit runs tests serially, i.e. one at
> a time, I've been told that there are occasions when JUnit runs tests
> concurrently, is this so? I can't see how this would be, as tests
> which access the DB would almost certainly fail if they were run
> conrrently.

JUnit never runs tests concurrently. You can, however, build
multithreaded test case classes.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
